modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is heavily imperative. It assumes the hearer has the 'Pouvoir' (power) to change if they simply accept the 'Devoir' (obligation) and 'Vouloir' (will).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Judgment/Nuclear threat) to Niet-S1 (The danger of looking back) to S1 (The bright future).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the human act of 'metanoia'—turning around. The tension is resolved by human movement.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is equated with nuclear war.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses high Christological language, the 'engine' is anthropocentric. The hearer is the Subject who must flee, must not look back, and must find the 'bright side'. Jesus is primarily a warner or a passive shelter rather than the active Savior.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: our eternal destiny depends on how it stands as between us and God

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as Primary Subject of Change
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: don't you rest until you find it

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: We have a shelter and a hiding place

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Lot's wife is used as a negative moral example to warn the hearer against the same internal failure.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: A theocentric reading would focus on God's mercy in dragging a reluctant Lot out of the city despite his hesitation.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety and pressure to perform a 'perfect' turn without looking back.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where human determination is the deciding factor in salvation.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically consistent but theologically confused between God's sovereignty and human effort.
spanning_punten: The quote 'I am the Lord thy God' (God as Subject) clashes with 'don't you rest until you find it' (Man as Subject).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus' earnestness is meant to motivate the hearer to make the right choice.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The hearer is expected to provide their own 'Vouloir' (will).

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High (equated with destruction), but treated as a choice of direction rather than a dead state.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a recruitment speech for moral reform rather than a proclamation of divine rescue.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'get out' and 'find the bright side'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the one who rescues the reluctant.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Get out!', use 'Just as the angel grabbed Lot's hand, God is even now pulling you from the fire.'

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero of their own escape.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Lot was 'reluctant' and had to be 'dragged'—salvation is God's work against our backward glances.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'Shelter' as an active person (Christ) rather than a passive umbrella.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The opponent is strong enough; the Subject needs to be switched to God to match this strength.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the Hiding Place (Christ) first, then the turning as a response to being found.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has great rhetorical power and seriousness, but it risks leaving the hearer in despair by making salvation dependent on the quality of their 'backward glance'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, this is a powerful 'fire and brimstone' speech. Actantially, it is a heavy burden on the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis focuses on the context of Sodom; Greimas shows that the preacher has cast the hearer as the 'Subject' of the verb 'to save'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that despite mentioning Jesus frequently, the 'action' of the sermon is entirely human-powered.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Atomic Bomb' as a modern semiotic equivalent to 'Brimstone' to increase the urgency of the 'Devoir-faire'.
